net.hudup.core.alg

Class RmiRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AlgAbstract
      • net.hudup.core.alg.RecommenderAbstract
        • net.hudup.core.alg.ServiceRecommenderAbstract
          • net.hudup.core.alg.RmiRecommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, Alg, AlgRemote, Recommender, RecommenderRemote, RmiAlg, ServiceAlg, ServiceRecommender, SetupAlgListener, Exportable, Inspectable

    public class RmiRecommender
extends ServiceRecommenderAbstract
implements RmiAlg
    This interface indicates an RMI service considered as an recommendation algorithm.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getDataset

        public Dataset getDataset()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Recommender
        Any recommender has always a reference to a dataset represented by Dataset class because recommender is executed on the dataset. Some recommender (s) store internal dataset but others only have references to dataset. Anyway, such reference always exists.
        Specified by:
        getDataset in interface Recommender
        Returns:
        reference to dataset.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • setup

        public void setup(Dataset dataset,
                  java.lang.Object... params)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RecommenderRemote
        Setting up this recommender based on specified dataset and additional parameters
        Specified by:
        setup in interface RecommenderRemote
        Parameters:
        dataset - dataset is the main parameter to setup this recommender.
        params - Additional parameters to set up this recommender. This parameter is really an array of sub-parameters. Its elements should be serializable for RMI.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error occurs.

      • unsetup

        public void unsetup()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RecommenderRemote
        Unset this recommender. After this method is called, this recommender cannot be used unless the method RecommenderRemote.setup(Dataset, Object...) is called again.
        Specified by:
        unsetup in interface RecommenderRemote
        Overrides:

        Throws:

      • estimate

        public RatingVector estimate(RecommendParam param,
                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> queryIds)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RecommenderRemote
        This method is very important, which is used to estimate rating values of given items (users). Any class that implements this interface must implement this method. Note that the role of user and the role of item are exchangeable. Rating vector can be user rating vector or item rating vector. Please see RatingVector for more details. The input parameters are a recommendation parameter and a set of item (user) identifiers. The output result is a set of predictive or estimated rating values of items (users) specified by the second input parameter.
        Specified by:
        estimate in interface RecommenderRemote
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        queryIds - set of identifications (IDs) of items that need to be estimated their rating values.
        Returns:
        rating vector contains estimated rating values of the specified set of IDs of items (users). Return null if cannot estimate.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • recommend

        public RatingVector recommend(RecommendParam param,
                              int maxRecommend)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: RecommenderRemote
        This method is the most important one in recommendation task. Any class that implements this interface must implement this method. Note that the role of user and the role of item are exchangeable. Rating vector can be user rating vector or item rating vector. Please see RatingVector for more details. The input parameters are a recommendation parameter and the maximum recommended items (users) in the returned rating vector. The output result is a list of recommended items (users) which is provided to the user (item).
        Specified by:
        recommend in interface RecommenderRemote
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        maxRecommend - the maximum recommended items (users) in the returned rating vector.
        Returns:
        list of recommended items (users) which is provided to the user (item), represented by RatingVector class. The number of items (users) of such list is specified by the the maximum number. Return null if cannot estimate.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • newInstance

        public Alg newInstance()
        Description copied from interface: Alg
        Create the new instance of algorithm, concrete algorithm is determined run-time.

        Returns:
